instructions: From the Home screen, swipe up or tap All apps . Tap Calendar . Tap View . Select from the following: Year Month Week Day Tasks
From the Home screen, swipe up or tap All apps . Tap Calendar . Tap Menu > Manage Calendars . Tap the individual emails that you wish to enable or disable.
From the Home screen, swipe up or tap All apps . Tap Calendar . Tap the plus sign . Enter the Title, date, time and details. When finished, tap Save .

From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Data usage . Turn on a data usage limit Select the Set mobile data limit slider.> Tap OK . A new horizontal orange bar appears in the graph. Touch and drag the orange bar up or down to the desired data amount. When you reach this data amount, your data connection is automatically disabled. From the graph, touch and drag the orange bar to the desired data usage setting. If you exceed this setting, your data connection is automatically disabled. To turn off a data usage limit, move the Set mobile data limit slider to OFF .

Turn on a data usage limit Select the Set mobile data limit slider.> Tap OK . A new horizontal orange bar appears in the graph. Touch and drag the orange bar up or down to the desired data amount. When you reach this data amount, your data connection is automatically disabled.

From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections', then tap Data usage . If necessary, tap the Data usage cycle field to select the time period to be studied for the data usage. Below the graph, the dates to be studied will be displayed. Swipe up and view the data usage for applications (largest to smallest).
